name: Torsten Söderström
content: Torsten Söderström, Department of Systems and Control, Uppsala UniversityStaff at syscon Torsten Söderström's home page Background I have a M Sc in engineering physics (Civilingenjör teknisk fysik), 1969, and a PhD in automatic control (Tekn Dr i reglerteknik), both from Lund Institute of Technology. I moved to Uppsala University in 1974, where I am a professor of automatic control. I was the head of the Department of Systems and Control 1975-1999. I am an IEEE Fellow. Research interests My main research interests are in the fields of system identification, statistical signal processing, and adaptive systems. More recent interests include also identification of continuous-time models, parameter estimation in infinite-dimensional systems, numerical algorithms in control and signal processing, and modelling and control of mechanical systems. Teaching Undergraduate teaching Fall 2003: Control design (F4, IT4) Computer-controlled systems (W4, STS4) More information Fall 2002: Control design (F4, IT4) Computer-controlled systems (W4) More information Spring 2002: Adaptive systems (F4) Fall 2001: Control design (F4, IT4) Computer-controlled systems (W4) More information Spring 2001: Adaptive systems (F4) Fall 2000: Sampled-data control systems (F4) Computer-controlled systems (W4) More information Teaching in the PhD programs Spring 2003: Stochastic dynamic systems, 10 units Fall 2001: Stochastic dynamic systems, 10 units Spring 2001: Recursive identification, 7 units Fall 1999: Stochastic dynamic systems, 10 units Research projects * Identification of continuous-time systems (part of the multiproject Statistical signal processing) * Errors-in-variables modelling * Identification of nonlinear systems (part of the multiproject Statistical signal processing) * Identification of viscoelastic materials (a previous progress report for this project) * Parameter estimation in heat conduction and diffusion (a previous progress report for this project) * Control of waves, vibrations and stability in mechanical structures * Numerical algorithms in systems and control PhD students currently working in these projects: Emad Abd-ElRady, Mei Hong,Peter Karlsson, Hans Norlander, Agnes Runqvist. Recently graduated PhD's  engaged in these projects: Bharath Bhikkaji, Erik K. Larsson, Kaushik Mahata. Some other professional activities Editor of Automatica, subject area System Parameter Estimation, 1992-present. Within IFAC, International Federation of Automatic Control, I was a Council member 1996-2002, Executive Board member 1999-2002, and Chair of the Awards Committee 1999-2002. Within EUCA, European Union Control Association, I am a council member, 2001-present. Selected recent publications Books T. Söderström: Discrete-Time Stochastic Systems - Estimation and Control. Second edition, Springer-Verlag, London, UK, 2002. (375 pp) A new printing of the textbook T. Söderström and P. Stoica: System Identification, originally published by Prentice Hall International, has been arranged. Details on how to order copies from us. If you have other questions, contact Ingegerd Wass.
